articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Greets King of Swaziland
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Greets King of Swaziland
 Pyongyang, September 5 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, Friday sent a message of greetings to Mswati III, king of Swaziland, on the occasion of the 42nd anniversary of its independence.
					  Kim in the message expressed belief that the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries would grow stronger in conformity with the desire and interests of the two peoples and wished the king greater success in his work for the stability and prosperity of the country.

articles.title: 2nd Forum of DPRK-China Univ. Presidents to Be Held
articles.content:
2nd Forum of DPRK-China Univ. Presidents to Be Held
 Pyongyang, September 5 (KCNA) -- The second forum of the DPRK-China University Presidents will be held in Pyongyang. 
					 Officials of at least 20 main universities of the DPRK and China are expected to participate in it. 
					
					 At the forum they will exchange each other's achievements and experience gained in the field of education and discuss the issue of boosting exchange and cooperation among the universities.

articles.title: "GNP" Accused of Moves for Revision of Fascist Law
articles.content:
"GNP" Accused of Moves for Revision of Fascist Law
 Pyongyang, September 5 (KCNA) -- The People's Solidarity for the Repeal of the "National Security Law" held a press conference on Sept. 2 denouncing the "Grand National Party" for seeking to retrogressively revise the fascist law.
					 The organization in a press release accused the GNP group of submitting to the "National Assembly" a "proposal on revising the SL" containing a poisonous provision that if a court rules any organization is an "enemy-benefiting organization," it should be disbanded. 
					
					 The organization charged that since the fabrication of the SL, it has earned an ill-fame as a tool for suppressing many progressive figures and organizations and the suppression of people by this evil law has become evermore undisguised under the present regime, arousing serious concern.
					
					 If the SL is allowed to undergo a retrogressive revision under this situation, it will entail such serious consequences as forcing civic and public organizations engaged in legitimate activities to disorganize themselves, the organization held, warning that the group of the treacherous party will be branded as an undemocratic and anti-reunification group for advancing the above-said proposal and certainly face a judgment of the people. 
					
					 The organization will carry on the struggle to the last for the repeal of the SL, it noted.

articles.title: Allegedly Involved in NDYSL Case Declared Not Guilty
articles.content:
Allegedly Involved in NDYSL Case Declared Not Guilty
 Pyongyang, September 5 (KCNA) -- The puppet Seoul Central District Court of south Korea Thursday gave a verdict of not guilty to three persons including Yun Han Bong, former director of the Institute for Studies of Future of the Nation, who were allegedly involved in the case of the National Democratic Youths and Students League.
					 When actions were staged to distribute leaflets opposing the "Yusin" system in Seoul in 1974, the fascist dictatorial forces proclaimed "emergency measure" No. 4, branding the above-said organization as an "underground organization for the communist revolution" and arresting many students through the mobilization of the CIA, police and prosecution of south Korea at that time and thereby bringing charges of "attempted rebellion" to them. This was known to be the case of NDYSL.  
					
					 At that time the fascist dictatorial forces sentenced them to prison terms on charges of violation of the SL and an attempt at a rebellion and mercilessly cracked down upon students. 
					
					 As regards this case, the puppet court authorities admitted the suppression by the then security forces and declared them not guilty.

articles.title: Memorial Services for Victims of Kanto Earthquake Held
articles.content:
Memorial Services for Victims of Kanto Earthquake Held
 Pyongyang, September 5 (KCNA) -- A memorial service for Koreans killed during the great Kanto earthquake was held in front of the monument to them in Tokyo on September 1 in connection with the lapse of 87 years since the massacre of Koreans committed by the Japanese imperialists after the disaster. 
					 Present there were Pak Ku Ho, vice-chairman of the Central Standing Committee of the General Association of Korean Residents in Japan (Chongryon) who doubles as chairman of the Committee for Rights and Welfare, Hwang Myong, chairman of the Tokyo Metropolitan Headquarters of Chongryon, and other officials and Koreans in Japan.
					
					 The participants paid silent tribute to the dead.
					
					 Hwang Myong recalled in a memorial address at the meeting that when the discontent with the government reached an extreme phase among the people who had been thrown into horror and uneasiness by the great earthquake that hit Kanto area on September 1, 1923, the Japanese authorities hatched a terrible plot to direct the spearhead of their attack to the Koreans in Japan.
					
					 The Japanese authorities' unprecedented bestial atrocities committed against Koreans in Japan were beyond human imagination in their brutal nature, he noted, and continued:
					
					 87 years have passed since the earthquake and it is a century since the fabrication of the "Korea-Japan Annexation Treaty", but the Japanese government has not clearly probed the truth about the incident, far from making apology and reparation for the atrocities. 
					
					 He demanded the Japanese authorities honestly reflect on Japan's invasion of Korea and its colonial rule and probe the truth about all its past crimes including not only mass killings of Koreans after the earthquake but the forcible drafting of them and the sexual slavery for the Imperial Japanese Army and make  apology and reparation for them. 
					
					 A representative of the Tokyo Assemblymen's Liaison Council for the Promotion of Japan-Korea Friendship noted in a speech made at the meeting that there goes on a serious development in which malignant anti-DPRK propaganda is rampant in Japan.
					
					 He denounced the Japanese government for still blocking the entry of ship Mangyongbong-92, persisting in its sanctions against the DPRK, and resorting to discrimination and suppression of even Korean students in Japan.
					
					 Speeches were made there.
					
					 On the same day similar memorial services took place in various places of Chiba and Saitama prefectures.

articles.title: US and S. Korean Authorities' War Moves under Fire
articles.content:
US and S. Korean Authorities' War Moves under Fire
 Pyongyang, September 5 (KCNA) -- The Central Committee of the Slovak Communist Party released a statement on August 28 denouncing the war moves of the U.S. and south Korean authorities, a factor of straining the situation on the Korean Peninsula to an extreme phase.
					 Accusing the U.S. of recently staging again the provocative joint military exercises against the DPRK together with the south Korean puppet authorities, the statement held that this saber-rattling put peace in the peninsula and in its vicinity to great peril.
					
					 It condemned the U.S. and its followers for such moves against the DPRK as defying the presidential statement of the UN Security Council calling for peacefully settling the pending issues of the peninsula through direct dialogues and negotiations.
					
					 It called on the international community to make efforts to check the undisguised military provocations threatening peace and security on not only in the peninsula but the rest of the world.

articles.title: National Day of DPRK Observed in Bangladesh
articles.content:
National Day of DPRK Observed in Bangladesh
 Pyongyang, September 5 (KCNA) -- Garib Newaz, president of the Bangladesh People's League, released a statement on August 31 on the occasion of the 62nd founding anniversary of the Democratic People's Republic of Korea.
					 The statement said that President Kim Il Sung founded the DPRK in which the popular masses became masters of the country and turned it into a socialist power independent in politics, self-supporting in economy and self-reliant in national defence, adding that his immortal exploits would shine forever.
					
					 It went on:
					
					 The DPRK is winning one victory after another, remaining undeterred by challenges of the imperialists and all trials under the leadership of General Secretary Kim Jong Il, peerless statesman, and greeted new heyday in building a socialist thriving nation.
					
					 The statement expressed belief that the Korean people would achieve successes in their struggle to achieve the independent and peaceful reunification of the country and open the gate to a thriving nation in the near future under the outstanding Songun leadership of Kim Jong Il and extended full support and solidarity to socialist Korea in its just cause.

articles.title: Anniversary of Start of Songun Leadership Observed
articles.content:
Anniversary of Start of Songun Leadership Observed
 Pyongyang, September 5 (KCNA) -- A joint seminar took place in Russia and meetings in Bangladesh, Denmark and Myanmar between August 24 and 25 to mark the 50th anniversary of General Secretary Kim Jong Il's start of the Songun revolutionary leadership.
					 The general secretary of the International Alliance of Societies for the Study of the Juche Idea and Songun Policy in East European and Central Asian Regions said at the seminar one can say that the Songun politics of Kim Jong Il was the main factor that enabled the DPRK, not a big country, to protect its sovereignty and dignity and win victory standing in confrontation with the U.S. styling itself the "only superpower" in the world.
					
					 The chairman of the All-Russian Society for the Study and Dissemination of Kimilsungism said at the seminar that Kim Jong Il has pursued the unique Songun politics, protecting the sovereignty of the country and dignity of the nation and reliably ensuring peace and security in the Korean Peninsula and the rest of Northeast Asia.
					
					 Rashed Khan Menon, chairman of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Bangladesh, Garib Newaz, president of the Bangladesh People's League, and others said in their speeches at a meeting that the history of Kim Jong Il's Songun revolutionary leadership is a praiseworthy history in which he built a matchless military force and led the showdown with the imperialists and the U.S. to victory.
					
					 Jorgen Petersen, chairman of the National Leadership of the Communist Party of Denmark, said at a meeting that Kim Jong Il formulated the Songun politics as a main political mode under socialism as required by the changed reality.
					
					 A message of greetings to Kim Jong Il was adopted at a meeting in Denmark.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il's Songun Exploits Praised
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's Songun Exploits Praised
 Pyongyang, September 5 (KCNA) -- The Peruvian Group for the Study of Kimilsungism released a bulletin titled "Immortal Banner of Cause of Independence-Songun Idea" on August 25 on the occasion of the 50th anniversary of General Secretary Kim Jong Il's start of the Songun revolutionary leadership.
					 The bulletin said in an article that the Songun idea serves as a banner of national prosperity as it calls for putting forward an army as a main force of revolution and placing military affairs above all other affairs and a line indicating the correct way of building a great prosperous and powerful nation.
					
					 It continued:
					
					 The Songun idea clarifies that a thriving nation can be built only under the leadership of the great party, by powerful defense capability and a genuine government serving the popular masses.
					
					 The policy of the Workers' Party of Korea that enables the People's Army to set an example in all aspects and encourages all the people to learn from it is one of the fundamental factors which put strong impetus to the building of a thriving nation. The army and people of the DPRK will invariably advance along the path chosen by themselves and surely achieve the socialist cause of Juche holding aloft the banner of Songun under the leadership of Kim Jong Il.
					
					  The organization issued a bulletin on August 11 to mark the 65th anniversary of Korea's liberation.
					
					 The bulletin under the title "Massacres Committed by the Japanese Imperialists in Korea" carried an article and photos disclosing barbarities committed by the Japanese imperialists after their occupation of Korea in the first half of the last century.
